At the edge of the crowd
Into crowd at end of RF line
Off Grimes' pitching hand.  Mgr Bush and several players gathered around the box to inspect the damage but Grimes insisted on finishing the game.

Boos & cheers greeted Alexander as he came to bat
Over LF brick wall, well into Waveland Avenue. Hornsby was given a great ovation for his 6th straight hit vs. Cardinals (7th straight overall).
Holm: sensational diving catch of low line drive
Doubthit made a great run for it; he turned and got his glove on it, but dropped it.
Singled to CF on a slow ball

Chick's 1st hit in 12 times at bat
Spectacular diving stop of hot smash
Weather: bad, wintry winds blowing from the north
Gonzalez injured his hand on a foul by Stripp
Weather: Cold, raw blasts of wind which whistled across Wrigley Field to the discomfort of the fans.
Wind blew pop fly out of Grimm's reach for a lucky 2-bagger.
Hargreaves bruised a finger in stopping a wide pitch.
Running catch in front of the bleachers
Pie Traynor was out of the lineup with a sore shoulder
Stroner's throw hit Cuyler in the back
Robbed of hit by great running catch
Sharply hit; Sheely fumbled it slightly then threw home too late.
Weather: chilly lake breeze Trader Horne's only ML start
Mild weather, with a Kansas wind that brings the home runs.
Cuyler lost it in the sun and it fell between him and Wilson.
The throw home trapped Bressler, but he beat Grace's throw back to 3B.
Ladies Day; there must have been about 10,000 women who got in free. Weather: frigid breezes blew from northeast

Cuyler juggled it and claimed he caught it; Cubs argued at length with Ump Rigler.
Wilson held on after bumping into RCF wall
After the 2nd inning attendance had increased to 40,000. Rope were stretched in LF for the overflow crowd.
Orsatti dropped it but ruled double
Hornsby collided with Cuyler but hung on

Deflected by Meine; whale of a play by Grantham

Hit in the face and fell beside the plate.  The players surrounded him and he finally arose and was escorted to the bench where the bleeding soon ceased upon application of cold water.  About 5 minutes after the mishap he was on 1B. After the game a surgical examination disclosed a fracture in the upper part of the nose where the bone is quite thin. He was in considerable pain.
A collision at the plate knocked the ball out of Hargreaves' glove and injured the catcher.
To the end of the foul line
Into the crowd back of LCF
A little grounder to the box; Nehf beat him in a race to 1B

Light rain was falling at 1:00, but an hour later the rain was over and the gates were opened. Threatening weather kept attendance down. Cubs were in a bad way for pitchers, but sent Charlie Root to the slab though he pitched half a game two days ago.
Great stop by McMillan of slow roller; Grimm made spectacular catch of McMillan's low wide throw.
McMillian attempted to score on a short passed ball
Ladies' Day; a half-hour before game time all seats were filled.  The overflow crowd was allowed on the field; a hit into any part of the overflow crowd went as a two-bagger.

Over Cuyler's head, the ball dropping into the crowd, but it was difficult for the umpires to see if the ball had cleared the screen in front of the right field bleachers.  Hendrick was stopped at 3B by Ump Moran.  Immediately the Dodgers rushed off their bench claiming that the hit cleared the screen for a home run.  There was a long argument, but the Dodgers' kick was in vain.
'Cuyler sent the crowd into an uproar when he singled past Moore, scoring Wilson with the tying run.  Wilson beat Hendrick's perfect throw to the plate by a narrow margin...'
Might be Penner's 1st ML appearance in 13 years!
'Before the game Cliff Heathcote was presented with a specially made ukulele.  Hack Wilson was presented with a large frosted cake by some young lady dressed in red, white, and blue.'
Taylor let Heathcote's throw get past him
When Kelly tried for 2B and drew a throw, Walker tried to score.
Ripped a single off Dressen's glove

Baseball-Reference.com writes, 'In the eighth inning of a 5-5 game at Wrigley Field, Cubs 3B Norm McMillan hits a line drive down the LF line with the bases loaded. Reds LF Evar Swanson, shaded toward center, can't find the ball, which he sees bounce off a gutter in foul territory. McMillan circles the bases and four runs score. Later, Cubs relief P Ken Penner picks up his jacket in the bullpen and discovers the ball in his right sleeve.'
